paragraphs: November 2022In the science fiction books I read as a kid, reading had often been replaced by some more efficient way of acquiring knowledge. Mysterious "tapes" would load it into one's brain like a program being loaded into a computer.That sort of thing is unlikely to happen anytime soon.

Not just because it would be hard to build a replacement for reading, but because even if one existed, it would be insufficient. Reading about x doesn't just teach you about x; it also teaches you how to write.

[1]Would that matter? If we replaced reading, would anyone need to be good at writing?The reason it would matter is that writing is not just a way to convey ideas, but also a way to have them.A good writer doesn't just think, and then write down what he thought, as a sort of transcript.

A good writer will almost always discover new things in the process of writing. And there is, as far as I know, no substitute for this kind of discovery. Talking about your ideas with other people is a good way to develop them.

But even after doing this, you'll find you still discover new things when you sit down to write. There is a kind of thinking that can only be done by writing.There are of course kinds of thinking that can be done without writing.

If you don't need to go too deeply into a problem, you can solve it without writing. If you're thinking about how two pieces of machinery should fit together, writing about it probably won't help much.

And when a problem can be described formally, you can sometimes solve it in your head. But if you need to solve a complicated, ill-defined problem, it will almost always help to write about it. Which in turn means that someone who's not good at writing will almost always be at a disadvantage in solving such problems.You can't think well without writing well, and you can't write well without reading well.

And I mean that last "well" in both senses. You have to be good at reading, and read good things. [2]People who just want information may find other ways to get it. But people who want to have ideas can't afford to.Notes[1] Audiobooks can give you examples of good writing, but having them read to you doesn't teach you as much about writing as reading them yourself.[2] By "good at reading" I don't mean good at the mechanics of reading.
You don't have to be good at extracting words from the page so much as extracting meaning from the words.Japanese TranslationChinese TranslationItalian TranslationFrench Translation

paragraphs.translated:
2022年11月  
在我小时候读的科幻书中，阅读常常被某种更高效的获取知识的方式所取代。神秘的“磁带”会像程序被加载到计算机中一样将知识输入到人的大脑中。  
这种事情在近期不太可能实现。

paragraphs.original: Not just because it would be hard to build a replacement for reading, but because even if one existed, it would be insufficient. Reading about x doesn't just teach you about x; it also teaches you how to write.
paragraphs.translated: 不仅仅是因为建立阅读的替代品会很困难，还因为即使存在这样的替代品，它也会显得不足。阅读不仅仅教你关于x的知识；它还教你如何写作。

paragraphs.original: [1]Would that matter? If we replaced reading, would anyone need to be good at writing?The reason it would matter is that writing is not just a way to convey ideas, but also a way to have them.A good writer doesn't just think, and then write down what he thought, as a sort of transcript.
paragraphs.translated: 这会有影响吗？如果我们不再阅读了，是否还有人需要擅长写作？写作之所以重要，不仅是因为它是传达思想的一种方式，还因为它是产生思想的一种方式。一个优秀的作者不仅仅是在思考之后，将所思所想如记录般写下来。

paragraphs.original: A good writer will almost always discover new things in the process of writing. And there is, as far as I know, no substitute for this kind of discovery. Talking about your ideas with other people is a good way to develop them.
paragraphs.translated: 一个好的作家在写作过程中几乎总会有所发现。据我所知，这种发现是无可替代的。与他人讨论你的想法是发展这些想法的好方法。

paragraphs.original: But even after doing this, you'll find you still discover new things when you sit down to write. There is a kind of thinking that can only be done by writing.There are of course kinds of thinking that can be done without writing.
paragraphs.translated: 但即使这样，当你坐下来写作时，仍然会发现新的东西。有一种思考只能通过写作来完成。当然，也有些思考不需要写作就可以进行。

paragraphs.original: If you don't need to go too deeply into a problem, you can solve it without writing. If you're thinking about how two pieces of machinery should fit together, writing about it probably won't help much.
paragraphs.translated: 如果你不需要深入研究一个问题，可以不通过写作来解决。如果你在考虑两台机器应该如何组装在一起，写下来可能帮助不大。

paragraphs.original: And when a problem can be described formally, you can sometimes solve it in your head. But if you need to solve a complicated, ill-defined problem, it will almost always help to write about it. Which in turn means that someone who's not good at writing will almost always be at a disadvantage in solving such problems.You can't think well without writing well, and you can't write well without reading well.
paragraphs.translated: 当一个问题可以被正式描述时，你有时可以在脑海中解决它。但如果需要解决一个复杂且定义不明确的问题，几乎总是有助于将其写下来。这反过来意味着，不擅长写作的人在解决这类问题时几乎总是处于劣势。你不能写得好而不善思考，也不能读得好而不善写作。

paragraphs.original: And I mean that last "well" in both senses. You have to be good at reading, and read good things. [2]People who just want information may find other ways to get it. But people who want to have ideas can't afford to.Notes[1] Audiobooks can give you examples of good writing, but having them read to you doesn't teach you as much about writing as reading them yourself.[2] By "good at reading" I don't mean good at the mechanics of reading.
paragraphs.translated: 我说的最后一个“好”有两层意思。你不仅要善于阅读，还要读好东西。[2]只想获取信息的人可能会找到其他方法来获得。但想要拥有想法的人却不能这样做。注释[1] 有声书可以给你提供好的写作范例，但听别人读并不如自己阅读那样能让你学到更多的写作技巧。[2] 我所说的“善于阅读”并不是指阅读技巧上的熟练。

paragraphs.original: You don't have to be good at extracting words from the page so much as extracting meaning from the words.Japanese TranslationChinese TranslationItalian TranslationFrench Translation
paragraphs.translated: 你不必擅长从页面中提取单词，而应该擅长从单词中提取意义。
